message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the phases of the moon. When the moon is full, its appearance is different than when it is in other phases. It appears as a complete circle, well-lit by the sun, and is much brighter than during other phases. Option (A) is incorrect because the size of the moon remains relatively constant throughout its orbit. Option (B) is incorrect because the weight of an object does not change based on its phase. Option (C) is incorrect because the moon's distance from Earth does not change significantly during its different phases.

This question requires basic knowledge about the appearance of the moon during different phases. When the moon is full, it appears round and completely illuminated. Therefore, the correct answer is (D) appearance. Option (A) is incorrect because the size of the moon remains relatively the same regardless of the phase. Option (B) is incorrect because the weight of the moon does not change. Option (C) is incorrect because the distance between the moon and Earth does not change significantly during different phases.
